meanings.definition: To give courage or confidence to
meanings.sent1: Seeing his friends cheer him on emboldened him to try the new activity.
meanings.sent2: The supportive words from her mentor emboldened her to speak up in the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The cat's meows seemed to embolden the tiny mouse, making it feel brave.
meanings.sent4: The rising sun emboldened the flowers to open up and show their vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The encouraging smile from the teacher emboldened the shy student to raise their hand.

meanings.sent1: The artist used a thick brush to embolden the outlines of the painting.
meanings.sent2: Adding a touch of red lipstick can embolden a simple black dress.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to embolden the flavor of the soup by adding extra spices.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed to embolden the storm, making it more intense.
meanings.sent5: The bold font choice emboldened the title of the book, making it stand out on the shelf.
